## 판결문 요약


391 S.W.2d 664 (1965)
Audra J. BARGER
v.
Leonard WEBB and American National Bank & Trust Company.
Supreme Court of Tennessee.
June 2, 1965.
*665 H. Keith Harber, Daniel C. B. Levy, Chattanooga, for appellant.
Jerry J. Phillips, Chattanooga, Miller, Martin, Hitching, Tipton & Lenihan, Chattanooga, of counsel, for appellee, Bank.
Stone & Kirkland, Chattanooga, for apppellee, Webb.
BURNETT, Chief Justice.
Mrs. Barger brought this suit against Webb and the Bank alleging that she and her husband purchased an automobile trailer from Webb, who in turn assigned their note to the Bank. The Bank repossessed this property and failed to comply with the provisions of T.C.A. § 47-1302 (effective when the acts herein happened), in that it did not post notice as required by statute, thus she sought to recover under T.C.A. § 47-1306 (effective when the acts herein took place) the amount she and her husband had paid (he had assigned any rights that he had to her) from Webb and the Bank.
To this bill the Bank filed a plea in bar in which it alleged in substance that this suit is barred due to former adjudication, election of remedies and accord and satisfaction. The plea of Leonard Webb raised substantially the same defenses.
